pkgmetadata.longdescription:
Aaargh is a dev-lang/python module that makes building friendly command line applications really easy. Applications built with Aaargh provide a single executable with a subcommand for each exposed Python function. Each subcommand may have its own command line arguments. This is similar to the way version control systems provide multiple commands using a single entry point. (Examples include bzr commit and git checkout).
Aaargh is named after one of the castles in the movie Monty Python and the Holy Grail. The acronym Aaargh stands for an astonishingly awesome application argument helper, but omits a few letters to make it triple A.
Aaargh is compatible with both Python 2.6+ and Python 3.
